gurmukhi: shMs hsq pRmwn lau sB hom hoq AnMq ]4]168]
transliteration: Sahans Hast Pramaan Lau Sabh Hom Hot Anant||4||168||
translation: Even upto one thousand arms’ length and all innumerable ones were burnt and (thus reduced to ashes).4.168.

gurmukhi: ricE srp myDM bfo j`g rwjM ]
transliteration: Rachio Sarap Medhan Bado Jagg Raajan||

gurmukhi: krY ib`p homM srY srb kwjM ]
transliteration: Darai Bipp Homan Darai Sarab Kaajan||||
translation: The Brahmins are busy in performing Home ritual whose merit is setting everything right.
Innumerable types of snakes are being burnt in the pit.

gurmukhi: BujY Bog AnMqM jugY rwj duAwrM ]1]169]
transliteration: Bhujai Bhog Anantan Jougad Raaj Duaaran||1||169||
translation: Innumerable cobras, drawn by the mantras at the gate of the king. Have been burnt.1.269.

gurmukhi: ikqY Ast hsqM sqM pRwie nwrM ]
transliteration: Kitai Ast Hastan Satan Praae Naaran||
translation: Many snakes of about eight arms’ length and about seven arms’ length, with necks;

gurmukhi: ikqY duAwdsY hsq lO prm BwrM ]
transliteration: Kitai Duaadasai Hast Lau Param Bhaaran||
translation: Many weighty serpents of twelve arms’ length
Many of two thousand arms’ length and many of one Yojana length;
They all fell in the fire-altar pit unconsciously.2.170.

gurmukhi: ikqy jojny duie ikqy qIn jojn ]
transliteration: Kite Jojane Due Kite Teen Jojan||
translation: Many serpents of two Yajana length and many of three Yajanas;

gurmukhi: ikqy cwr jojn dhy BUm Bogn ]
transliteration: Kite Chaar Jojan Dahe Bhoom Bhogad||
translation: Many of four Yajanas length, all these serpents of the earth were burnt;
Many of the size of a fist and a thumb and the length of a span;
And many of the length of one and a half span and many of the size of half a thumb were burnt.3.171.
